data.meta_description: Gene Shapiro Auctions LLC Soundview Plaza 1266 E. Main Street ...
data.text: Gene Shapiro Auctions LLC Soundview Plaza 1266 E. Main Street, 7th Floor Stamford, CT 06902 Phone: (203) 539-6024 Fax: (215) 745-1056 IMPORTANT RUSSIAN, EUROPEAN, AND AMERICAN ART 10/20/2007 LOT # 1 HANZEN, ALEXEI ALEXEI VASILIEVICH HANZEN (RUSSIAN 1876-1937), "Sailboat off the Coast," oil on board, 3 1/4 x 4 in. ( 8.2 x 10 cm.), signed lower left and signed on the verso. 1,500.00 - 2,500.00 2 HANZEN, ALEXEI ALEXEI VASILIEVICH HANZEN (RUSSIAN 1876-1937), "Off the Coast of Dubrovnik," 1927, oil on board, 3 1/4 x 3 7/8 in. (8.2 x 9.8 cm.), signed lower right 'A. Hanzen', signed, dedicated, and dated on verso 'Im Zeichen Hochachtung und Dankarbeit / A. Hanzen / Dubrovnik / 1927' (Respect and Gratitude / A. Hanzen / Dubrovnik). 1,500.00 - 2,500.00 3 REPIN, ILYA ILYA EFIMOVICH REPIN (RUSSIAN 1844-1930), "A Farmhouse," watercolor, 5 1/2 x 8 7/8 in. (14 x 22.5 cm.), signed lower left, with a drawing by an unindentified artist on the verso. Authenticity confirmed by Vladimir Petrov. 6,000.00 - 10,000.00 4 RUSSIAN 19TH CENTURY Porcelain Plaque of an Officers' Ball, Imperial Porcelain Manufactory, Period of Nicholas I, dated 1838, finely painted. Based on an original work by Adolphe Ladurner. Signed lower right 'N. Sesliavin 1838' in Cyrillic, and lower left 'Ladurner' in Latin characters. Held in wooden frame. 11 3/8 x 15 3/8 in. (29 x 39 cm.). Imperial porcelain manufactory hallmark on verso. 60,000.00 - 80,000.00 LOT # 5 PROKOFIEV, ALEXEI ALEXEI MATVEIVICH PROKOFIEV (RUSSIAN B1859), "Shoreline at Twilight," oil on canvas, 23 1/2 x 39 in. (59.7 x 99.1 cm), signed lower left. In antique period frame. 8,000.00 - 12,000.00 6 SUDKOVSKY, RUFIN ATTRIBUTED TO RUFIN GAVRILOVICH SUDKOVSKY (RUSSIAN 1850-1885), "A Calm Sea," 26 1/8 x 40 1/8 in. (66.5 x 102 cm.), signed lower left. 20,000.00 - 30,000.00 7 PAVLOV, V. V. PAVLOV (RUSSIAN 19TH CENTURY), "A Biblical Scene," 1891, oil on canvas, 37 x 55 7/8 in. (94 x 142 cm.), signed and dated upper right. 12,000.00 - 18,000.00 8 POPOV, LUKIAN LUKIAN VASILIEVICH POPOV (RUSSIAN 1873-1914), "A Spiritual Landscape," oil on canvas, 21 5/8 x 34 1/4 in. (55 x 87 cm.), signed and dated lower left. Lukian Popov was one of the famous group of 'Peredvizhniki" or 'Itinerant' Artists. He studied at the Imperial Academy of Arts from 1896-1901, and was a member of the Itinerant Art Exhibitions since 1903, and the Kuindzhi Union since 1905. Popov exhibited with the Peredvizhniki from 1900 to 1915. 20,000.00 - 30,000.00
